_glossaryItems.description: Consists of buttons which expand or collapse to reveal or hide the content inside.
Displays images at full width (one component) or half width (two components).

An open-source software is a computer software that is released under a license in which the copyright holder grants users the rights to use, study, change, and distribute the software and its source code to anyone and for any purpose. An open-source software may be developed in a collaborative public manner.

In Adapt, the back end is the part that is not directly accessed by the user, typically responsible for storing and manipulating data.

For example, when you program your course, you program it in the back end. You see the front end when you select Preview Course, and the learner sees the front end of the course in Saba.

The Open courses' resources is a button, located in the top right corner of this window. It allows you to access the following:

  • Glossary: to consult any unfamiliar terms;
  • Resources: to view additional resources for this course;
  • Search: to search words in this course.
